1. Profile: The Profile is opened through the profile item on the corner of the Global
Header.
2. Modal header: The top section of the side panel consists of a modal header which
will give the user the option to close the panel by clicking the X icon. This modal
header is also present on the desktop side panel.
3. Profile card: The side-panel also contains a profile card of the user currently logged
in. This profile card contains an image, name, role and department of the user.
There's also a button present within the profile card for quick actions. This button is
the only clickable within the profile card.
4. List item: The Profile actions are accessed trough the list item, each of which
consists of a title and description. The Profile side panel does not go deeper than 1
level of navigation.
5. Language Selector: The user has the opportunity to change the language right from
the Profile side panel, making it easy and avoiding deeper navigation. The native
drop-down of the device will be used for the language selector.
Responsive layout
The Ingka Co-worker Design Subsystem uses, spacing, grids and breakpoints standards
from Skapa. Please read here if you are looking for general information about them.
Breakpoint (S)

Xx list item with a title and a description. We recommend to use this
list item styling by default. The title is emphasised, with an inset
. and a trailing icon, like a chevron or another icon, like copy. The

Navigation levels
The Profile side panel has one navigation level. All user actions should be placed on the
second level of the Profile. Do not make the user navigate deeper to multiple levels. You
can add certain actions on the second level of navigation, like copy, as long as the user
is not navigated deeper through multiple levels. The divider is fullwidth on the profile,
on the first navigation level the divider has some padding on the left and right.

List items
We have several options for the Profile side panel in terms of list items. Based on Skapa
recommendations, do not mix different list items styles within the Profile side panel.
Other than that, the maximum amount of list items is five.

language. The language selector should trigger the native drop-down functionality of
the device being used. Do not create your own drop-down styling.

Motion
The Profile side panel has 3 elements that involve motion. The Profile card is always
sticky, even when the user is scrolling within the scrollable area. The language selector
at the bottom also stays sticky, to ensure the user always has an easy way of changing
the language.

Accessibility
Keyboard Interactions
The Profile is consisted of buttons and navigation items to access content. All items can
be reached by Tab. By using Enter key can access any of the list items, this will update
the main content area and put focus back to the top of the page. Activating the X icon
(with Enter) on the top right corner will close the panel, and put focus back to the
triggering element, which is the Profile icon in the Global Header.
X

CC
List items can be reached by Tab, and Enter key is used to activate links. Dismissing the panel will put back the focus to the Profile icon in the Global Header.
Landmarks
Ingka Co-worker Design applies a navigation landmark around the Profile. If a page
includes more than one navigation landmark, each should have a unique label. This
help people who use assistive technology to make a mental model of a screen's
content.
X
Chris Silva Monteiro
Inbound Team Lead
IKEA Amsterdam, Amsterdam
